Stalker.Summary: Stalker uses Gear tokens for strength and provides [Light] at [III].

Brimstone.Summary: The more [Light] you have, the more powerful Brimstone gets.

Ehrlingal.Summary: Ehrlingal provides [Light] at [II] and is a [Dagger] specialist.

Felin.Summary: Felin can shapeshift her form, depending on the situation.

Gendarme.Summary: Gendarme uses secret Dwarven magic to empower your [Weapons].

Baharan.Summary: Baharan uses strange magics, allowing you to discard cards for bonuses.

Darkrend.Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Darkrend.Summary: Using forbidden blood magic, Darkrend inflicts [Wound] to power her attacks.

Grimwolf.Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Grimwolf.Summary: Risen to complete his mission, Grimwolf bleeds ([Wound]) to power himself.

Honormain.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Jadress.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Moonblades.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Stormskull.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Aird.Summary: Aird uses your opponents’ strengths against them.

Arcanian.Summary: Arcanian's sorcery changes dice rolls. She also provides [Light] at [II].

Dunardic.Summary: Once a Town Guard, Dunardic uses your [XP] as a resource.

Veris.Summary: Veris has the ability to make [Weapons] glow bright.

Graeme Crawford.Summary: This grizzled veteran may not like you, but he'll heal you. When the situation calls for it, he can imbue his attack with [Magic Attack].

Khomros.Summary: Better at battling the [Aberrations] and [Plants] of the sewer, Khomros uses whatever [Weapons] he finds (discards from your deck).

Ophialyn the Tracker.Summary: Ophialyn is the best hunter of [Beasts], [Fey], [Giants], [Golems], and [Humanoids]. She learns to track like a [Rogue] at [Level II].

Runiva Highstone.Summary: Experienced at battling [Beasts] and [Giants], Runiva will light the path if she can find (discard from your deck) the right spell.

Uvina the Delver.Summary: Uvina delves through (discards from) your deck, getting extra [Gear] for your next venture.

Wiltran Proudmore.Summary: Wiltran brews [Potions] and focuses his efforts on healing your [Wound Cards] by discarding them straight out of your deck. He learns [Wizard]ly arts at [Level II].

Breezy.Summary: A master of the elemental arts.

Drulfal the Primordial.Summary: Drulfal is adept at both wielding and withstanding the elements.

Lefira.Summary: Lefira gets the most out of [Bread] tokens and [Edged Weapons]. She produces [Gold] at [Level II].

Lilande.Summary: This elven bard learns the arts of the [Wizard] at [Level II] and the [Fighter] at [Level III]. Lilande’s tale is best if you have a [Side Quest] or [Prestige Class] to relate.

Rugduhr Blackmane.Summary: Rugduhr maximizes his [Gear] while he hunts the one he once served.

Samly Thrackson.Summary: Samly destroys the impurities and inefficiencies he finds in decks.

Damilu Huskie.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Daramere's Cloak.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Potion of Light.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Ring of Proficiency.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Bracers of Cleansing.Summary: [Village] or [Dungeon]: Discard 3 cards from your deck. Heal 1 [Wound Card] discarded or gain 1 [Light].

Neverending Rope Spool.Summary: After this card is discarded from your deck, draw it if you have a [Rogue]. [Village] or [Dungeon]: Give 1 [Hero] the [Rogue] keyword and +1 to the values they have printed: [Physical Attack], [Magic Attack], [Skill], [Light], [Level], and [Gold]. Discard 1 card from your deck for each [Rogue] you now have.

Studded Leather Shirt.Summary: +1 [Physical Attack] if this [Hero] is [Human] or wields a [Weapon]. You may resolve the [After Battle] from 1 Studded Leather Shirt per turn, or 2 per turn if this is a [Fighter]. [After Battle]: Take −1 [Wound] from Monsters this turn.

Wand of Illumination.Summary: [Spoils]: If you have a [Cleric], [Wizard], or [Halfling], gain 1 [Lantern] token.

Eternal Flame.Summary: You may only give this card’s +[Magic Attack] and +[Skill] boosts to a [Dwarf] or [Cleric].

Ice Climbing Gear.Summary: This card’s [Skill] and [Light] values each have +1 when given to a [Halfling] or [Rogue]. Ignore [Alert] effects from Dungeon Rooms.

Snow Trekking Tools.Summary: [Frostbite Wounds] you take are [Wounds] instead. [Dungeon]: Discard this card and another card to draw 1 card.

Tent.Summary: You may ignore [After Battle] abilities from Dungeon Rooms. [Spoils]: You have +1 [HP]. You may only use [Spoils] from 1 Tent per turn.

Death Pact.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Mirror Image.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Tempest.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

True Seeing.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Blizzard.Summary: 1 [Magic Attack] for each of your [Frostbite Wounds]. [Dungeon]: +2 [Magic Attack]. Take 1 [Frostbite Wound].

Cone of Cold.Summary: When you gain this card, roll [1d6]. On a 4+, destroy 1 of your cards. [Magic Attack] equal to your highest [Wizard]’s [Level]+1.

Create Fire.Summary: [Bread] tokens used to boost [Heroes]’ [Skill] also give the [Hero] +1 [Physical Attack]. [Bread] tokens used for [Gold] produce +1 [Gold].

Inner Fire.Summary: Monster [Before Battle] are [After Battle] instead for you. This card has 1 [Light] if you have a [Cleric] or [Wizard], or 2 [Light] if you have 1 [Hero] with both keywords.

Acid Burst.Summary: Reduce the [Defense] of the Monster you battle this turn by your highest [Wizard]’s [Level], or [Level]+1 if battling an [Aberration], [Golem], or [Humanoid].

Ascendance.Summary: -[Cost] equal to the total [Level] of all [Clerics] and [Wizards] you have. [Village] or [Spoils]: Level up 1 [Hero], paying [XP].

Cure Disease.Summary: [Village] or [Dungeon]: Heal 1 [Wound]. If it was a [Disease], also heal 1 [Wound]. You may give 1 [Cleric] +[Magic Attack] equal to the [Cleric]’s [Level].

Haste.Summary: After this card is discarded from your deck, give 1 [Hero] +1 [Physical Attack] and +1 [Skill]. [Dungeon]: Give your [Heroes] and [Heroes] in your Party +1 [Physical Attack] and +1 [Skill]. When discarding cards from your deck this turn, discard +1 card.

Broadsword.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Crossbow.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Flail.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Two-Handed Sword.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Fire Rod.Summary: −5 [Skill] for [Clerics] and [Wizards], or −3 [Skill] for [Rogues] and [Humans]. [Spoils]: Gain 1 [Lantern] token.

Mechanical Harpoon.Summary: −2 [Skill] for [Halflings] and [Rogues]. [Spoils]: If this is wielded by a [Hero] with 6+ [Skill], gain 1 [Bread] token.

Bastard Sword.Summary: −2 [Skill] for [Humans]. [Spoils]: If this is wielded by a [Fighter], level it up, paying [XP].

Battlepick.Summary: After this card is discarded from your deck, you may give it to a [Hero] with 5+ [Skill] to wield. [Dungeon]: Discard 2 cards from your deck.

Cleaner’s Net.Summary: You may ignore [Alert] effects from [Plants], [Swarms], and [Vermin]. They have −1 [Defense] and −1 to their [Wound] value against you. [Spoils]: You may destroy this [Weapon].

The Five Points.Summary: −2 [Skill] for [Dwarves] and [Tritons]. After this card is discarded (from anywhere, but not from the turn ending), gain 1 [Bread]. [Village] or [Dungeon]: If unwielded, discard this card.

Elmoran.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Hobgoblin Brutes.Summary: They attack Heroes and their equipment.

Spider Terrors.Summary: They wound heavily ([Wound] and [Wound Card]) and are drawn to equipment.

Corrupted Elves.Summary: Destroy your [XP] or suffer their wrath.

Foundational Keepers.Summary: These Ogres attack as soon as they refill the Dungeon (but not at game setup).

Corrupted Centaurs.Summary: They are each susceptible to a particular Class, but resilient against others.

Treefolk.Summary: They are worth much more if you defeat them convincingly.

Chaos Lizards.Summary: They discard your cards based on the outcome of dice rolls.

Moor Skeletons.Summary: They deal [Wound Card] and are resistant to [Physical Attack] and [Edged Weapons].

Marsh Trolls.Summary: They have immunities to different cards.

Air Servitors.Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Air Servitors.Summary: They tend to be vulnerable to [Magic Attack]

Water Servitors.Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Water Servitors.Summary: They move throughout the dungeon making it unpredictable.

Earth Servitors.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Fire Servitors.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Divine Founders.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Abyssal Founders.Quest: At the Foundations of the World
Abyssal Founders.Summary: The chaotic nature of their dice rolls make them unpredicatble. [sic]

Doomknights.Summary: They attack Heroes who try to move through their room.

Gnoll Raiders.Summary: They destroy your Weapons and Gear.

Minions of Chaos.Summary: They destroy your Heroes based on the outcome of dice rolls.

Ancient Wyrms.Summary: They like to snack on (attack) your Heroes.

Ancient Protectors.Summary: They are immune to Heroes with low [Skill].

Arctic Animals.Summary: Arctic Animals are well-adapted to stalking their chilled prey, attacking as you enter or leave the room.

Abyssal Servants.Summary: Abyssal Servants chill your bones, reducing your [HP].

Bloodfrost Clan.Summary: Unimpeded by the cold, the Bloodfrost Clan strikes hard and fast, both before and after battle.

Tundra Wolf Pack.Summary: A Tundra Wolf Pack’s numbers and attacks are as fast as they are unpredictable, striking before and after battle. (This [Swarm] gains +[1d6] [Defense].)

Frozen Natives.Summary: An ancient race of half-dog, half-humans, the Adlet attacks are devastatingly unpredictable.

Ice Behemoths.Summary: The arctic wastes abount with high [Defense] behemoths who ask no questions.

Drain Dwellers.Summary: They attack you when you try to move out of their room.

Plague Rats.Summary: This swarm can number in dozens or hundreds, but it often brings disease. (This [Swarm] gains +[1d6] [Defense].)

Ghoulish Scavengers.Summary: They use your diseases against you.

Sewer Trogs.Summary: The Sewer Trogs are heavy wounders.

Shapeless Spawns.Summary: These [Aberrations] of the deep grow stronger with your [Wound Cards].

Waste Wyrms.Summary: Heavy wounders that deal both [Wound Cards] and [Wounds].

Miricelle, Scion Defender.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

After Battle.Text: Place your Champion in the [0] room.
Place your Champion in a [II] room.
Place your Champion in the [0] room.

Spoils.Text: Level up a Hero for 2 less [XP]. Place your Champion in the [0] room.

Special.Text: Unless you have a Rogue, discard 1 card from your deck. +[Health] = the card's [Cost]
You may take 1 or more [Wound] to reduce this room's [Light] by 1 for each [Wound] taken.
Roll 2d6. +[Health] = the lower value rolled, or the total value if you rolled doubles.

Air Temple.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Water Temple.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Special.Text: Refill this room from the other [I] room. Then, refill that room from the Monster deck.

Earth Temple.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Requires.Text: If your total Attack ([Physical] + [Magic]) exceeds this Monster's [Health] by 3 or more, you have +1 HP.

Fire Temple.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

Abyssal Temple.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

After Battle.Text: Refill this room face down. Turn this room's Monster face up before a battle here; if it is not defeated put it at the bottom of its deck.

Spoils.Text: Gain [XP] equal to your total [Light]. At the end of the turn, place your Champion in the 0 room.

Special.Text: Gain [XP] equal to your total [Light]. At the end of the turn, place your Champion in the 0 room.

Celestial Temple.Quest: At the Foundations of the World

After Battle.Text: Place your Champion in the [0] room.

Special.Text: For each [Light] you have, reduce the [Health] boost of this room by 2.
For each [Light] you have, reduce the [Health] boost of this room by 2.
For each [Light] you have, reduce the [Health] boost of this room by 2.
